catalog_info.title: Structural Geology and Tectonics
catalog_info.notes: Course includes a weekly three-hour lab to be arranged. Given in alternate years.
catalog_info.prereq: Recommended: EPS 21 or permission of instructor.
catalog_info.description: An introduction to the deformation of Earth materials, including the processes of mountain building and plate tectonics, faulting and earthquakes, folding, and ductile deformation. Structures are examined using geologic maps, balanced cross sections, seismic reflection data, satellite imagery, microscopic analysis, analog experiments, and numerical methods. Labs emphasize the applications of structural geology in the energy and environmental industries, and for assessing earthquake hazards.
